title: _act_
author: _act_
content: I downloaded Sparrow wallet from this site: https://sparrowwallet.com/download/ which I think it is the Sparrow wallet official site. I downloaded the Windows Installer (7+) Sparrow-1.7.7.exeWhen I want to install it, my computer showed this:Is it save to install it? The last time I installed an app with this warning, my computer started to malfunction. I am using Windows 10.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: One of Sparrow developer said it's normal thing[1], so yes it's safe to install. Although if you want to be extra secure, perform PGP verification and ask around whether other people hold same public PGP key for Craig Raw (the one who sign Sparrow download files).[1] https://github.com/sparrowwallet/sparrow/issues/447#issuecomment-1057942802

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on July 18, 2023, 08:35:53 AMOne of Sparrow developer said it's normal thing[1], so yes it's safe to install. Although if you want to be extra secure, perform PGP verification and ask around whether other people hold same public PGP key for Craig Raw (the one who sign Sparrow download files).[1] https://github.com/sparrowwallet/sparrow/issues/447#issuecomment-1057942802Thanks you very much. There can be some phishing site these days. I went to that site through search engine and it looks original but there can be fake ones too which is the reason I ask the question on this forum. Which means that is a correct Sparrow wallet site not a fake site.

comments.author: o_e_l_e_o
comments.body: The fingerprint for the PGP key I hold for Craig Raw is below:Code:D4D0D3202FC06849A257B38DE94618334C674B40I have verified multiple versions of Sparrow successfully using this key.

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: Take into account that Windows Defender does this quite often, because its algorithm involves checking similarities in code structure as with known malwares. It has done it to one my applications, which I had written Visual Studio, and involved Bitcoin libraries (which I suppose are used in lots of malwares). I confirm I have the same fingerprint as o_e_l_e_o, which expires in 2023-10-03.

comments.author: blue Snow
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on July 18, 2023, 08:03:17 AMThe last time I installed an app with this warning, my computer started to malfunction. I am using Windows 10.That might be a false positive. I often see this warning when I installed the application. because it's quite annoying to me, I shut down it in settings > Windows security > Off check application and file (or set value to 0 in EnableSmartScreen > HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System.). I brave to do this because the PC i used is not installed application with regarding to money

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: I would say that OP has a lot of bigger problems considering the protection it uses than the fact that this protection is causing him such problems. If you're already using W10 or any other version of that OS, at least buy yourself some respectable protection when it comes to AV or firewall.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Just like the notification says, Windows Defender is only informing you that you are running a piece of software it doesn't recognize. That doesn't make the app safe nor unsafe to run. I have seen this with work-related apps I run on my end - no issues with them.What you should concentrate on is downloading, verifying, and only then installing crypto-related software from official websites. In that order. Don't trust Google to point you in the right direction because they couldn't care less about you.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on July 21, 2023, 09:13:11 AMWindows Defender these days is OK software though and IMO it's good enough for cautious user like OP. Even the best anti-virus and firewall software won't be of help if you don't know what you are doing and you are gullible to fall for various social engineering tricks. It's better to be cautious and look at everything as a possible threat than to click, download, and accept everything without thinking about it. Or simply get a cheap device for some of your more dangerous online habits, and don't use your main computer for such things.
